greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest c such that 1/n=1/c+1/b has integer solutions with c>b.
example: a(10)=30 since 1/10=1/20+1/20=1/30+1/15=1/35+1/14=1/60+1/12=1/110+1/11, but the first sum does not have c>b, leaving the second sum to provide the value.
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jul 23 2001
